content.title: Young Interns Program
content.details: The Young Interns Program (YIP) is an internship program, envisaged by the Government of Rajasthan, for providing opportunities for talented and progressive youth to upgrade their skills by gaining practical experience working in programs, schemes and projects of the government departments. The program is mutually beneficial to the government as well as the interns.
benefits: Laptop Connectivity and Mobility Support of ₹ 2500/- per month
One casual leave every month on an accrual basis
eligibility: Good knowledge of English and Hindi
Well-versed ICT skills and knowledge of MS Office
Mandatory to have own Laptop and data card/internet facility
Post-graduate qualification with a minimum of 60% marks or a CGPA of 6 on a scale of 10
Graduate applicants from Engineering/Medical/Law/CA/CS Streams with a minimum 60% mark or a CGPA of 6 on a scale of 10 are also eligible
exclusions: The YIP does not provide any assurance or guarantee for a permanent job
The government may terminate the internship at any point without obligation to cite reasons
Internship can be terminated for misconduct or unsatisfactory performance
Interns cannot opt for additional jobs during the internship
content.application_process: Online applications will be invited through the Rajasthan Single Sign-On (SSO) Portal.
documents_required: Letter of Intent (in Hindi or English)
Domicile Certificate of the state of Rajasthan
Proof of Age (Birth Certificate or Marksheet of Class 10th)
Proof of Educational Qualification (Passing Certificate / Marksheet)

faqs.question: What Are The Objectives Of The Young Interns Program (YIP)?
faqs.answer: The objective of the Young Interns Program (YIP) is to provide opportunities for talented and progressive youth to upgrade their skills by gaining practical experience working in programs, schemes and projects of the government departments.

faqs.question: How Is This Internship Program Mutually Beneficial To The Government As Well As The Interns?
faqs.answer: The program is mutually beneficial to the government as well as the interns as: 1. The Government is benefitted by infusing novelty and innovation in the project implementation and service delivery system through the youthful and courageous ideas & techniques of the young interns. 2. The Interns are benefitted by attaining knowledge of project implementation and the ecosystem of the government functionalities.

faqs.question: What Shall Be The Duration Of The Internship? Is It Extendable?
faqs.answer: The internship is of a one-year duration. After the end of the first year, if the mentor/nodal officer feels and recommends the extension in the internship duration on the basis of the performance of the intern, the duration of the internship may be increased by one more year with six months at a time.

faqs.question: What Can The Maximum Duration Of The Internship?
faqs.answer: In no circumstances, the duration of the internship shall be more than two years.

faqs.question: What Is The URL Of The Rajasthan Single Sign-On (SSO) Portal?
faqs.answer: The URL of the Rajasthan Single Sign-On (SSO) Portal is: https://sso.rajasthan.gov.in/signin
